private_information: can only move when at a place
truck0.goal: Help achieve the goal arrangement of crates by transporting crates between places while respecting capacity constraints.

private_information: can only move when at a place
truck1.goal: Help achieve the goal arrangement of crates by transporting crates between places while respecting capacity constraints.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist0.goal: Assist moving crates at depot0 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist1.goal: Assist moving crates at depot1 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist2.goal: Assist moving crates at depot2 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist3.goal: Assist moving crates at distributor0 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist4.goal: Assist moving crates at distributor1 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: can lift/put/load/unload crates at co-located place
hoist5.goal: Assist moving crates at distributor2 to meet global crate placement goals.

private_information: You are the sole planner responsible for producing PDDL domain and problem files
You must respect all agent constraints and the provided initial state
orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem encoding the multi-agent crate transport and rearrangement task that respects capacities, hoist constraints, and fuel-cost accumulation.

private_information: used for verification and ensuring objective minimization
supervisor.goal: Monitor and verify that the produced plan achieves the global goals and respects all constraints.

public_information: Trucks are mobile carriers between places
Hoists operate only when co-located with crates/trucks and enforce single-use availability
Crates can be stacked on pallets or on other crates; crates are also surfaces
Numeric fluents: truck current_load, truck load_limit, crate weight, fuel-cost
Driving a truck increases fuel-cost by 10
Hoist lifting/placing operations increase fuel-cost by 1

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent numeric PDDL modeling and optimization. You will be given a detailed initial state and goals for a crate transport and rearrangement domain with trucks and hoists. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem encoding that captures objects, predicates, numeric fluents (including fuel-cost and truck loads), actions for driving trucks and hoist operations (lift, put-down, load-into-truck, unload-from-truck), capacity guards, and effects/conditions exactly as described. Ensure actions are annotated by which agent performs them (truck.* and hoist.*), respect single-use resources (clear, available, lifting), and include fuel-cost increases and numeric updates. Use total-time or fuel-cost minimization objective equivalent. Provide domain between <domain></domain> tags and problem between <problem></problem> tags.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
Truck constraints and private info: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
Hoist constraints and private info: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Supervisor info: {agents->agent_details->supervisor->private_information}.
Think step by step and produce a PDDL domain and problem that exactly model the initial state and goals, include numeric fluents and capacity guards, and enable minimization of fuel-cost (total-time surrogate). Do not assume facts beyond those given. Output only the PDDL domain and problem files enclosed in the specified tags.
